isis.stitle: TSI 97-08-06 - Ammeter Sensor Mounting Stud Nut Tightening Torque and Method - 3000RE

subjectgroup.subject: Ammeter Sensor Mounting Stud Nut Tightening Torque and Method - 3000RE

geninfo.para: When it becomes necessary to remove the ammeter sensor or positive terminals from the ammeter mounting stud, it is important that the mounting stud nut is correctly tightened during reassembly. Failure to follow this procedure may result in stripping the stud from the mounting block.
The ammeter sensor mounting assembly ( Figure 1) consists of a 3/8-16 stud and molded block ( Figure 2), 1/2-13 extension stud ( Figure 3) and washers and nuts.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE

warning.para: Batteries expel explosive gases. Keep sparks, flames, burning cigarettes, or other ignition sources away at all times. Always wear safety glasses and a face shield when working near batteries to prevent personal injury.

note.para: Disconnect the negative battery terminal during any electrical system repair.

svcproc.para: Reassembly of ammeter sensor and extension stud:

step1.para: Mount the starter motor cable connectors onto the 3/8-16 stud ( Figure 2) and washers. Thread the extension stud ( Figure 3) on and tighten to 10 ft-lbs. (13.6 Nm) torque.
Install the ammeter sensor onto the extension stud taking care the molded hex in the sensor mates with the hex on the extension stud. Position sensor with connector down and facing outboard.
Install the alternator and feed cable washer and nut. Tighten the nut to 10 to 12 ft-lbs. (13.6 to 16.3 Nm) of torque while holding the hex on the extension stud with a backup wrench.

caution.para: Failure to use a backup wrench while tightening the nut in Step 3 may result in damage to the stud/molded block ( Figure 2).
